thread.title: Lifeboat called to aid flooded fishing boat off Shetland
thread.title_full: Lifeboat called to aid flooded fishing boat off Shetland

title: Lifeboat called to aid flooded fishing boat off Shetland
text:
Lifeboat called to aid flooded fishing boat off Shetland 14 March 2017 These are external links and will open in a new window Close share panel Image copyright David Tait Image caption The Edward Henry has eight crew on board A lifeboat has gone to the aid of a crab fishing boat which has lost power off the Shetland islands. 
The Edward Henry, with eight crew on board, called for help after it was hit by a wave which struck its bridge and was flooded about 40 miles west of Shetland. 
The RNLI's Aith lifeboat launched at about 20:20 and a coastguard helicopter was standing by. 
The plan to attach a line onboard and tow the vessel back to Shetland.
